dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Hemmings!  Sam, I thought I told you to  close up shop and be ready to move up the  island by night-...

dialogues.speaker: HEMMINGS
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain Brynner, you did, but-but--

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...what, Sam?  Can't I go down to the  loading dock for a few hours without  coming back to find a major...

dialogues.speaker: HEMMINGS
dialogues.text: Uh, with all due respect, sir, Dr. Long  told me to prep the field for detonation  at...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Jesus Chri--  We're on a very slippery  slope here, Sam.  A covert military  operation riddled with civilian...

dialogues.speaker: HEMMINGS
dialogues.text: You don't think it's that bad, do you,  sir?  I mean, Long's spent the last two  years developing his defoliant.  The  stuff can't even kill crabgrass yet.

dialogues.speaker: HEMMINGS
dialogues.text: ...out here, captain.  Don't you think  the guys deserve a break?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: We're not gonna take chances on our last  day.

dialogues.speaker: TELSTAR
dialogues.text: I thought we wrapped the tests yes-...

dialogues.speaker: TELSTAR
dialogues.text: ...gonna shit if he finds out we haven't  closed up...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: I had something of an epiphany this  morning, Telstar.  I eliminated the  binary shell and I grafted the cobalt ion  to the other side of the molecule.  I  think it might give us a significantly  more rapid chemical ignition.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Well, (clears throat) Costello's finished  with the stability profile, but Abbott is  still chewing on the load file.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: So reaction temperature is fifty degrees.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: Well, your prediction was on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: How much longer for the range and power  projections?

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: (sighs) (raspberries) I don't know.  Um,  he's working, but there's a lot of data.   Maybe...another hour?

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: We don't have an hour.  We're already  supposed to be shut down.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: What the hell is all this about a  detonation today?  We're scheduled...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: I don't work for you, Captain Brynner.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Sweeney tells me you don't have computer  confirmation?

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: You know, captain, if you hadn't spent so  much of your career questioning your  superiors, you might've found yourself  with more gold leaf on your col-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: This isn't some kind of pissing contest,  Long.  You may be in charge here, but  those men out there are my responsi-...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Look, this is a scientific experiment,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: If it works, your stock at the Pentagon  will go up along with mine.  I don't  think I need to mention you could use the  help.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: The NSA thinks the UN is onto your  work...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...here, and the White House is screaming  about chemical weapons, (face off) and  we're...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...sittin' here with our hands in the  goddamn cookie jar!  And let me tell you  something else.  I didn't join the  service to let people like you turn...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...the United States into the kind of  country we're supposed to be fighting  against.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (overlapping) But you have no choice but  to follow orders.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Now, I know.  You have moral objections  to what we're doing here, but believe...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: ...me, if I thought there was any real  danger, I-I wouldn't go forward.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: You have my word on that.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (sighs) (whispering) All right. (in  normal voice) One more shot, provided...  (sighs) we're off the island tonight.

dialogues.speaker: TELSTAR
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...Elvis is  approaching the stage.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: And make sure Hemmings hears you say it.

dialogues.speaker: MEN AT SITE
dialogues.text: (low and indistinct chatter and grunts -  continues under following scenes and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: HEMMINGS
dialogues.text: (off) All right, we're movin' out, men.

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: (panting) I got eight thousand yards.   Radius is five...

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: (off) (panting) ...miles. (pants -  continues under following scene and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: SWEENEY
dialogues.text: ...-dicting the effective detonation  radius is five...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Damn you, Long!  My people are out there!   Your people are out there!

dialogues.speaker: TELSTAR
dialogues.text: (gasps and pants - continues under  following scene)

dialogues.speaker: TELSTAR
dialogues.text: (off) (overlapping) (sobbing) Please let  me in! (sobs indistinct - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (voice over) It is the opinion of this  review panel...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (voice over) ...that the verdict  delivered in this case is justified, and  that you are in fact...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (voice over) ...guilty of criminal  negligence resulting in the deaths of  eighteen members of a military research  team...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (voice over) ...on the date of August  eighteenth, nineteen seventy-seven.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (reading) "It is also this panel's  opinion that the sentence of reduction in  rank...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (off) (reading) ...forfeiture of all pay  and allowances and twenty years in the  United States disciplinar-...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (reading) ...-y command at Fort  Leavenworth is justified.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (reading) Furthermore, you are advised  that, while you are a prisoner, you  remain bound by the National Security Act  of nineteen forty-sev-...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (off) (reading) ...-en.  If you divulge  classified information or discuss the  nature of the project in which you were  involved...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMS
dialogues.text: (reading) ...you will face further  prosecution."  Do you under-...

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: I assume your silence indicates assent.   Transfer to Leavenworth will be  immediate.  You're dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: ...I wish they would've let me say  something...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) There's nothing to say,  doctor.  Someone had to take the fall,  and they still need you, whereas...I've  never been anything more than a thorn in  their collective side, as you once said.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: So I'll be locked safely away in some  hole along with my secret sins.  And  yours.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Been trying to figure out your secret.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Ten months we've been fishin' this  river together.  We use the same  equipment, more or less...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) ...but you pull twice as many fish  out of the water as I do.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And I'm good at this.  Been doing it  since I was a kid.  But you, I don't  know.  Somehow you think...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (chuckles) (chuckling) No, that's not  possible, Mason.  The trout... (grunts)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (face off) How can we ever hope to win  against the trout?

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: There's only one way you can do it,  Mason.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) Turn the power of the hunter  against him.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) ...create a piece of bait that  sends the fish's instincts into  overdrive...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: ...forcing him to strike.  And only then  does our noble friend realize that the  prey...can bite...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Some people might say you're readin' an  awful lot in-...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: But I don't think you would.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (off) ...-son.  Of all the days for you  to show up late. (sighs) First, the idiot  April calls in sick.  Then I got a bad  tooth...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: ...and then my night man shows up when he  feels like...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Darlene, it's five-thirty.  Now, I worked  late for you this mornin', and you didn't  wanna spring for over-...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, I have got to get to the  dentist be-...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: ...-fore he closes, which means you're  gonna have to cover the grill and the  floor.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Mm.  It doesn't take a genius.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (sighs) Oh, caught a few, lost a few.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Story of my life. (sighing)  Well, one thing you won't lose is that  friend of yours back there, I'll tell you  that.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Oh, you're two of a kind, doc.  Oh, he  may not have your sheepskins, and...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (off) ...well, most of the time he looks  like something the cat might have dragged  in, but, you know...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Uh, we both like to fish.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: His I know.  Yours I don't have a clue.  (grunts) But if it wasn't for you, I  think he'd have drifted right on through  this town.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: You know, I have yet to get a simple cup  of coffee and a meal in this place,  Darlene.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: And you ain't gonna start now.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: And don't give him any ice cream...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (off) ...like April.  It gives him gas.   And make sure there's (on) two pots of  coffee...

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (off) ...ready before the morning crowd  blows in.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (overlapping) ...ready before the  morning crowd blows in.  I got it...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...not at all like a man responsible for  the deaths of eighteen peo-...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Is that why you're here?  To blame...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) ...me?  Well, you could've saved  yourself the trip.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: I know where the (chuckling) blame  belongs.  But I didn't put you in prison,  Andrew.  The government did...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm well aware of what the government  did, I assure you.  Actually, I've just  come to say how grateful I am to you...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Together, you gave me the opportunity to  realize just how very wrong my life had  gone.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) Do you remember telling me once  that all through my career, I'd never fit  in?  Well...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...you were right, of course.  But  after...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) ...years of thinking the matter  over, I began to see that the whole thing  wasn't really my problem.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: What rational man could fit in with the  sorts of things our government was doing?   The sorts of things you've...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Do you think I haven't seen the bodies of  those...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) ...men every time I've closed my  eyes?  But after you went away, I--

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Went away? (chuckles -  continues under following scene)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: All right.  After they put you away...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: ...I began trying to find ways of  controlling the effects of the weapon  that we tested on Horn Island.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: And let me guess.  You failed.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Why is it you scientists can create  implements of destruction...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) ...so quickly, but when it comes to  cures and benefits, your...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) Though at least you're trying,  Richard.  And if the road to hell is  paved with good intentions...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...we know you'll find your way there  quickly.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: It's not such a bad place.  I should  know, after all.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPER
dialogues.text: Morning, doc.  Awful early, aren't ya?

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep, Pumper.  Is everything,  uh, all right tonight?

dialogues.speaker: PUMPER
dialogues.text: There's nothin' goin' on out there,  doc...except maybe the occasional fly  fisherman.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Colonel Brynner.  I've got an appointment  to see Doc-...

dialogues.speaker: MP
dialogues.text: Can I see some I.D., sir?

dialogues.speaker: MALE RAPPER
dialogues.text: (over speaker) (raps under following  scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: What, do you work for my boss, dog?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: At least somebody likes this shit.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SINGER
dialogues.text: (over speaker) (sings low and indistinct  under following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: A little early for a delivery.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...yeah.  Tryin' to get most of my day  done before it hits nine-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Sam?  Andy gave Sam a nice big desk to  park his fat ass behind.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Where do you want this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Morning, Mason.  Two large coffees to go,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: So, Mason, last Wednesday night,  uh...were you out...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) ...uh, drifting around like the  trash you are, or were you here workin'?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: If it was Wednesday night, I was workin'.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (face off) Do you recognize this young  man?

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) ...badge someday, then you can ask  the questions.  Until then...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) ...selling this young man beer  Wednesday night.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't sell beer to minors.  I take that  kinda thing...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) ...hear it.  As a matter of fact--

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Take it easy, Pappas. (to  Mason) Mason, this boy says you did sell  him beer...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) Mason, you wouldn't know the truth  if it bit you.  We've got your whole  record. (chuckles) We know about the-the  conviction for vagrancy...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I didn't sell the boy any...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth until I tell you...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You know, I gotta tell you.  That really  bothers me, somebody calls me "son."

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Then how about if I call you "ass-...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: ...-son, maybe the kid showed you a fake  I.D. or, uh, you forgot to check.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I didn't forget to check, and I know how  to spot a fake I.D.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Especially from a little geek like  that...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: ...Mason, I don't wanna hear about you  sellin'...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I didn't sell any alcohol  to any--

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I'm not saying you did.   Just don't, okay?  You make sure you keep  your nose clean, we won't have any  problems. (to Pappas) Let's go, Pappas.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: No, sir.  I've never seen this guy  before.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Sure as hell have met a few assholes like  that, though.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) (chuckles) (on) You gotta learn to  lighten up when the man's in your face.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm with you on that one, my man.   Prick.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Look, you need me to sign an invoice or  somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Uh, between this month and last month,  you owe four hundred and seventeen  dollars.  And we need that in cash.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Darlene didn't say anything  about it to me, so tell Andy to bill her  like usual and let them sort it out.   Move.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Well, he told me to collect cash.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey, you and I are seein' eye to eye on a  whole range of issues this mornin'.  (chuckles - continues under following  scene)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Except for the fact that I need cash.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: He could've.  That-That's true.  But that  would've been smart...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...two things Andy is not.  Uh, but I  tell you what.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (face off) Bein' that it's cash, I'm  gonna give you ten percent...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...off.  Say, uh, three seventy-five.   Seein' that we both have so much love...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...for Andy, I'll tell him I lost a few  cartons comin' over (face off) the  mountain.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: That'll make up the difference, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Well, Darlene usually gives me a signed  check for emergencies.  I could always  give you that.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No, no, no, no, no, no.   Wait.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Night Shift, see?  A check is not cash.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Cash got a whole lot of numbers on it.   Pictures of old white men with messed-up  hairdos.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (sighs) All right, all right.  I-I'll go  you one better.  Two seventy-five and  I'll tell him you'll make up the  balance...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (pants - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Shit!  Oh, shit. (grunts - continues  under following scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (grunts and pants - continues under  following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (panting) ...his truck? (pants -  continues under following scene and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (panting) Mason, you have to take this...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (face off) (panting) ...to Fort McGruder  in his truck. (pants - continues under  following scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Wait.  This town is full of trucks.  Nice  new trucks.  You don't need to go...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Turn around at the gas station.  Look  behind the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: So you called the damned thing Elvis

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) I had no idea how powerful it  was.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (shivering) Eighteen men were k- killed in sec-...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (shivering) ...-onds...with just a  fraction of what's in...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) ...here. (groans) (grunting)  Mason... (shivers - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) ...about the man who did  this, he's-he's comin' after it.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (shivering) ...have it.  You have  to...have to get it to M...to McGruder.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (whispering) ...why don't you make it a  hundred and fifty dollars.  We'll call it  a day.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) (into radio) Move.  This is already  affecting our schedule.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Dennis, radio the bikes.  I  wanna know if so much as a squirrel...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) The compound has to be kept  cold...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (shivering) ...or it'll ignite.  (shivers - continues under following  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) Never let it reach fifty  degre-degrees.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) That's w-why you need his  truck...

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN
dialogues.text: This was supposed to be a...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: You have ten percent of a hundred million  dollars comin' your way.  I think we can  impose on you for a little overtime.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) You're the only one I can  trust.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (off) (shivering) The only one who  understands what this me-...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (shivering) ...-m-means, Mason.  (continues indistinct) (pants - continues  under following scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (off) ...sir.  Our satellite link is on  schedule.  Should I start the feed?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) Get 'em on line, then stall.  Long  can't have gotten far.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Vaughn, Burke, move to the end of the  street.  Fan out and work your way back  to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We gotta get help. (to himself) Aw, fuck!  (panting) Damn.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Well, then, how about a cup of coffee,  Darlene?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I assume you want that to go.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Uh, you wanna hunt outta season, it's  cool with me.  But mostly, well, they  just take a six...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: ...and a rifle.  You, on the other  hand...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: ...look like you're after something more  dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Actually, I was just looking for a  restroom.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: There is one in the back.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth, we're looking for  a scientist who's gone missing from the  Tech Center.  Maybe you know him.   Richard Long.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Doc Long.  Yeah, I know him.  Weirdo guy.   He comes in from...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That'll be fifty cents for the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) Dude in uniform get in your face,  you do not shoot your mouth off.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: No, no, no.  You don't need my truck.   You need somebody else's truck...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Look, if I don't get this stuff to  McGruder, it's goodbye, Andy's Ice Cream,  goodbye, Jerome, goodbye, Mon-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Wait, wait.  You don't believe the dead  guy, do...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I believe him.  He was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) Hey, listen!  Do you know what I  think?  I...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...think he was a wacko.  And I think  that G.I. ninja's a bigger wacko.  And I  think you're the biggest wack-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...-o of all, wantin' to be a part  of this wacko shit!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You are seriously mistaken if you think  you are going anywhere in my...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Then you drive me to McGrud-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO

dialogues.speaker: ARLO

dialogues.speaker: MASON

dialogues.speaker: MASON

dialogues.text: Hey, you're gonna piss me--  What the  hell are you supposed to be...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: How far you got to go?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Look, put this in the back.  Keep it  safe.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: There we go.  There we go.  Did you keep  it safe?  Did you (continues indistinct)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Come on, get in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Well.  It appears someone's been lying to  us.

dialogues.text: Sir, all potential customers have been  informed of the delay.  Fur-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: No.  A pair of average citizens have  decided to risk their lives for their  country.  I almost remember what that  feels like.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Billings?  No, no, no, no, no.  We need  to go to McGruder.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: No, you gotta go to McGrud-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no.  We gotta go to  McGruder!  I go where the truck goes!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: To get to McGruder, you have to go  through Missoula, and I ain't goin' to  Missoula.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No way.  We're goin' through McGrud-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Look...I kinda borrowed the truck from  Andy.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I did not steal this truck!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: ...what all the bullshit about the cash  was, wasn't it?!  You stole this truck,  and now you're trying to sell...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I didn't steal the truck!   He owed it to me!  Anyway, the important  thing is I'm not goin' through Missoula!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Look, I don't give a shit if you go  through Missoula at a hundred miles an  hour.  We're goin' to McGruder.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And remember, I still have this.  Yeah,  that's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) I'm about to get in your ass like  last year's underwear, man.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: We can't push old Pete in this heat.  He  can't take it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You better speed old Pete up.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Ah, one of them's in the back.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no.  Keep goin'.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me you hijacked me with  an empty gun?!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) When this is all over, re-...

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN
dialogues.text: Looks like our share just got bigger.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE BIKER
dialogues.text: (grunts - continues under following  scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Get him to stand up, Night Shift.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: So you're sure it was Mason?

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL MANAGER
dialogues.text: He came out of the store with the ice  cream guy.  The men from the base, they  took off...

dialogues.text: It must've happened right after we left.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Missoula's reporting the refrigerator  truck as a stolen vehicle.  I told you  Mason was walking shit.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Pappas, that other guy was unloading ice  cream into a freezer.  Now, what could he  have to do with a military scientist,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: The sooner you get up the lab, the sooner  you'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (face off) (grunts) (on) (pants)  (panting) Elvis is on ice again.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Don't gimme that "nice job" shit, man!   They still got a vanload comin', and what  do you got besides an empty...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (panting) It's goin' through. (pants -  continues under following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) You gotta b--! (to Arlo)  They put me on hold!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Probably because they know a psycho when  they hear one.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey, take a look at your situation and...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...reconsider that statement there,  Night Shift.  You're psy-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Every time I look at you, I wanna hit...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: And I'm a peaceful man, and...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...you stole the truck to  uphold your principles, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I did not steal the truck.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: It was owed to me.  You stole the damn...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Shut up, shut up!  It's  beeping.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Well, then, that means it's call...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) You (face off) snatch that (off)  phone (face off) from me one more time,  I'm--

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Hey!  Hey! (into  telephone) Andy's Ice Cream.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) Dutiful citizens, you  have something which I have waited years  for.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Give it to me now, or  you'll be dead...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Contrary to what Dr.  Long may have told you, this is  neither...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...your concern nor your  fight.  Relinquish the package and you  can go.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) I don't know what the  hell...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) Don't be tedious,  waiter.  Dr. Long called it Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (voice over) You have no idea what you're  in possession of, do you?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (into telephone) I got three thousand  dollars of highly perishable ice cream  products that taste bad enough when  it's...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...frozen!  So if you  don't mind--!

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) (overlapping) Just give  me Elvis and I'll make sure you have  enough money for a dozen ice cream  trucks.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (into telephone) I don't ever wanna see  another ice cream...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) I want you to look at  one another...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...and ask a simple  question -   Are you actually prepared...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...to die for a country  that's...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...never done a thing  for you?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Because if you don't  give me that cylinder, your lives will  end...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...on this miserable  road to nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) And I can't guarantee  the end will be quick.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Elvis is fuckin' dead,  man.  Get yourself some CDs.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN
dialogues.text: You can't fire on them.  You're gonna  detonate the crystals.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Your move. (to Vaughn) Okay, Vaughn, you  drive.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (face off) All right, you got it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) Go!  Got it, got it, got it!  (groans)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You can just bend over and kiss your  crazy ass goodbye, buddy! (pants -  continues under following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You think we can make what?! (pants) You  see that truck?!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Eight and a half feet wide!  Weighs over  five tons!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey, and what if we (off) don't make it?!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Your weedkiller on steroids goes down  with us!  Everybody (off) dies!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't think we have much of a choice...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (pants - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Oh, Petey.  Oh, Petey.  Oh,  please, Pete.  Please don't do this to  me.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (pants) (panting) I should've had that  dog bite me.  I would've gotten rabies!   Could've went to the hospital, had a  pretty nurse!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Go, go, go, go, go.  Oh,  shit.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) I'm goin'.  I'm goin', baby.  I'm  goin', I'm goin'.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. (to truck) Come on, old...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...-hood of you knowin' any prayers  is slim...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) All right, you got it, you got it!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) Got it, got it, got it!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?!  I'm the one  drivin'!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Shit.  You gotta pass him. (pants -  continues under following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) (indistinct - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) (overlapping) (indistinct -  continues under following scene and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (grunts and pants - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) (grunts and pants - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh, Pete.  Oh, shit!  Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (grunts) Oh, shit.  Oh,  shit. (pants - continues under following  scene)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. (panting) It's okay.  Okay.  (grunts - continues under following  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Gimme that, gimme that, gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (panting) Okay.  Okay.  (pants - continues under following  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (face off) (sighing) Aw, shit (continues  low and indistinct) (grunts and pants)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (pants - continues under following scene  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, put it back!  We're takin' off.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, what's goin' on here?  Are  you...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) Stay back!  I'm taking your boat.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You're not dangerous!  You're crazy!  I  ain't gettin' in this damn thing!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't want you to come anyway. (pants -  continues under following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (yells - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping, indistinct chatter, grunts  and yells - continues under following  scenes)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (pants - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (yells - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (grunts - continues under following  scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!  Take the boat?!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (grunts) (panting) There's nothing in  here, sir.  They got away with it.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: All right.  Let's clear the mess and move  out.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: This thing just went up a degree.  Ice  cream's not workin'.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: This river's fed by a glacier.  Willing  to bet my life that it's a good deal  under fifty degrees.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey, you didn't happen to lock the truck  up when you got out...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: See, now why would you do that to a man  in my posi-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't steal the truck.  You...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Hey, I told you I did not  steal that truck.  Andy owes me a lot  more than that four-wheeled...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: It won't even start half the time.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I deserve a lot more than that truck!   Ten years, ten years I busted my ass for  that fat rat bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) And he swore, he swore once I got a  degree...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...there'd be a sales rep desk with my  name on it.  But every time something  opened up, there'd be some idiot  cousin...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...or nephew or some good old  boy...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...just ready to just slide him right in  there.  And what about me, huh?  What  about Arlo, huh?  What about my needs?   You know, I got a-I got student loans...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Nobody's lookin' out for my interests.  (grunts) My credit was fucked!  And then  when he promoted Sam over me, I just  snapped.  So I split.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: So I took his truck, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (face off) This river ends at a hydro  dam...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...in Missoula.  All we need to do is get  to Mason before anyone else does.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Carl, Dennis, get out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Officer Pappas, I'm glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Mind if you tell me what's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: I'm Colonel Brynner, U.S. Special  Operations Com-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) We were called in by the Jerome  base...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...to pursue a man who's stolen  government proper-...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's wanted in connection with a  death this morning at the Jerome...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Long went missing from the Tech Center  this morning along with a very  dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...weapon.  Deputy, I'd deeply appreciate  your assistance on this.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Who knows?  It might even put some more  gold on that collar of yours.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You know, four years ago, I was a split  end at Kentucky State.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Started every game my senior year.  Not  all-American or anything, but not bad.   Anyway, the real star was my best friend,  the quarterback.  Got taken in the first  round.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I remember him.  Got in a car crash or  somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We were celebrating right after the  draft, going from bar to bar.  I was  drivin'.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And I put the car into a ditch.  He spent  eighteen weeks in the...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Never gonna throw a ball in the pros.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (sighs) Couldn't deal with it.  So I  split.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (face off) And (off) things sort of just  went downhill from there.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Anyway, about ten months ago, I wound up  in Jerome, workin' for Darlene.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Well, shit.  Could be worse.  I mean,  we're both up shit's creek, but at least  we have a paddle.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, colonel.  There's four dead,  but the security video's clean.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: It's a patched-in feed.  It's probably a  loop.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Deputy, I'm Colonel Vitelli.  I'm on  special as-...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Deputy Art Lewis, Jerome County Sheriff's  Department.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you'd like to tell me  what this is all about.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: I will tell you what I...

dialogues.speaker: BIG RANGER
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Colonel Vitelli.  We got a  busted-in cold vault inside.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Alert seventy-fifth rangers.  Code Blue.   Tell them Elvis has left the building.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talkin' about...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Well, I've got Dr. Long's body down at  the coroner's office.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: One of our units is pursuing a suspect up  the thirty-...

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: If you're right, Lewis, this Mason is one  hell of a pro.  He must have a service  record and a paper trail some-...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Mason? (chuckling) No, he's a soda-jerk  drifter, a hamburger flipper.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: It could be a cover, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Whoever did this is a man who knows his  business.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: ...for whatever it's worth, I'm sorry I  dragged you into this...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth, you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I mean, if that gun was...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...loaded, I didn't buy you as a shoot- ...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...Long.  Somethin' about that look in  his eye when he talked about that  Elvis...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Well, all the same.  If we get to  Missoula, help me find a car.  I'd  appreciate it.  Then...you can...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Like I said, I got a pretty good idea of  what's at stake here.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) We need to finish this, Night  Shift.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hang on to your ass, Missoula!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Arlo's back...and he's bringin' the King.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (sighs) Well, that just about figures for  today.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: It's, uh, parked just off of Highway  Thirty-Five.

dialogues.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
dialogues.text: I did what I could for you...

dialogues.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
dialogues.text: (off) ...Arlo, and you screwed me for it.   Now, where's my goddamn truck?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I ain't got time to argue with you today,  Andy.  But I can tell you this.  Takin'  your truck pissed you off?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You're gonna (chuckling) be real mad when  I take the pickup.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (growls) And so Missoula's prodigal son  returns.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) I got someone who's  anxious to talk to you, Mr. Mason.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: I urge you to be persuasive.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: This country trained me to kill...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Why don't you get that tub of shit Sam  to...

dialogues.speaker: ICE CREAM ANDY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (pants) Look, I'm sorry.   I'll make it up to you.  Whatever you  want.  Please!

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I have never been known for  my...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: All right, all right.  Hey, hey.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (over telephone) I think you oughta cut  a...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (over telephone) Even though it is nice  to see Andy...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) (into telephone) ...squirm, I don't  want his brains all over my shirt...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Yeah, I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) You still there, Mr.  Mason?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (over telephone) Then meet me at the dam  in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into telephone) And be intelligent about  this.  Tricks will cost lives.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (voice over) Create a piece of bait  that...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (voice over) ...sends the fish's  instincts into overdrive...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) Tryin' to remember somethin'  somebody once told me about tyin' a fly.

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (voice over) And only then does our noble  friend realize...

dialogues.speaker: LONG
dialogues.text: (voice over) ...that the prey can bite  back.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sir... (grunting) I think you should take  a look at this.  Judging...

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: ...by the signature pulse and  velocity...helicopters.  Maybe fifteen  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Rangers.  That was only a matter of time.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Of which we have more than enough.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (face off) Now, this is the guy we're  lookin' for! (off) His name is Tim Mason!

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (off) And he's got the acrylic container!

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You don't need to know!  Let's just get  it back, all right?!

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE AT CARNIVAL
dialogues.text: (off) (low and indistinct chatter -  continues under following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You try anything, it goes in...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: It's a little late for matinee heroics,  Mason.  Just give me the con-...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  You would've killed us anyway.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Just when we have all the cards, Vaughn.  (chuckles) Take these two behind the van.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: I got the container!  Bring it in...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter who he is!  We're goin'...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Gas masks?  Gas masks?  The men on Horn  Island had gas...

dialogues.speaker: PATROL CAP
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Horn Island?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) Good to see you again, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: I can't say it's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: And I certainly can't say it's pleasant.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: As soon as I heard Elvis was on the  loose, you came to mind.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: I checked your release date.  I never  liked coincidences.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: And I don't like deviations from plans,  Leo, as I'm sure you re-...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Colonel, sir, who the hell is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) ...-ner.  We did two tours together  in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Until he got busted down to nursemaiding  scientists.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had a small problem with members  of our side murdering civil-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...I lost all my squeamishness at Leav- ...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) ...-enworth.  I'll have no  compunction at all about using this.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Hm.  The wind's northwest.  That oughta  be...Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) Or I may be wrong.  The breeze  could be gusting south.  That'd be  Billings...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ...maybe even Salt Lake, not to mention  Casper...

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Knowing you, Brynner, you've got buyers  waiting to buy! You're not gonna use  that...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: And I'm warning you, Leo.  Don't test me.   Get your men and your machines off my  radar screen in five, or three million  people will die.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Tell the choppers we're lifting off!

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Your colonel's giving you a wise order,  soldier.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Sir, we can't just let him get away with  this!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Gomez, you fight the  battles you can win.  Now, we've been  outmaneuvered here.  Brynner's next move  is gonna be to get Elvis out of the  country and sell him to the highest  bidder.  To do that, he has to have  planned an exit point.  That's where we  intercept him.  That's where we make our  play.  Now you and your men back off.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) We're gonna use them for  demonstration (on) footage.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Having witnessed the effects myself, I  can assure you it'll be very useful when  the bidding starts.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (face off) Get 'em in the (off) middle of  the dam.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Geneva's comin' up, and we should have  Karachi and Kabul in a cou-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: All right.  Tell the pilot we'll be a  half-hour.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Dennis, we will open the bidding at one  hundred million...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (face off) (pants - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Put your hand in my pants.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (face off) We're gonna die, and you want  me to do some freaky shit like that?!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (face off) (grunts) I'm sorry.  I'm a  little (continues indistinct)

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Stay put. (to Dennis) Keep the camera  trained on...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: ..their deaths will be equally effective  and inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Sir, I got Taipei grindin' on me here.   How long is this supposed to ta--?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Pakistan says they'll be back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (off) And Taipei just went off-line, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You just can't leave that stuff with that  lu-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (pants) That's why I didn't  give it...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) ...to him. (pants - continues  indistinct under following scene and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Aw, shit.  Would you be more care-...

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (face off) Positions. (on) We're taking  up the hunt.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (panting) Come on, Brynner, it's over.   Nobody said anything about goin' up  against Rangers.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Besides, how are we gonna sell something  we don't have?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Nothing has changed, I assure you both.   The Army still thinks we got Elvis.  They  had a tactical withdrawal.  It's just  those two amateurs now.  Do you really  want to concede a hundred million dollars  to them?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Carl, establish contact with  that deputy we met earlier.  He'll be  more useful now.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: All right, there's a service station on  the other end of the Northridge Tunnel!   They'll have ice!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Here's what I want you to do.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: ...got the local airports covered, sir.   Pentagon's covering the interna-...

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Good. (to Gomez) Gomez, I want two birds  back to Missoula.  I wanna...

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Colonel, you've got a Tim Mason, patched  through from McGruder.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into telephone) This is Vitelli.  Is  that...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (overlapping) (into telephone) I've  got the real thing!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) What we gave Brynner on  the dam was a phony!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (over telephone) We've got the real  thing!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) (into radio) We've gotta take out  Brynner's van before (on) they reach...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Get ready to take it out!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (yell and cheer - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (voice over) Uh, so head for the other  end of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into radio) I'll stay here and secure  this position.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: What do you think I'm doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: I said let me see your hands now!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You redneck idiot, do you have...

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, asshole.  I'm puttin' a murder  suspect and a guy who...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Let me put it in easy terms, Aristotle.   We are carrying a damn bomb...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...if we don't get out of this tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Mason, what is the  temperature of Elvis?!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into telephone) If you're not out of  there soon, I have got to seal the...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Well, why don't they talk to the sage of  Jerome here?!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) ...on the other end of this phone.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: His name's Vitelli.  Talk to him.  He's  right out-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (sighs) (pants - continues under  following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...the guy the Army guys are lookin' for!

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Bullshit. (to Mason) Put the phone down,  Mason.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (off) I've heard enough of both of ya.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (panting) Wait.  Listen to  me, Pappas.  If you don't let us by...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (panting) What's it say? (pants -  continues under following scenes and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (over radio) Major, we've gotta seal that  tunnel!  Major!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into radio) It's too late, Mason.   I've...

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (off) ...we're gonna seal that tunnel!  I  want it air-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (panting) All I had to do was get it...

dialogues.speaker: FAT MAN IN TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Ice?  You want ice?  I got a whole case  of beer...

dialogues.speaker: FAT MAN IN TUNNEL
dialogues.text: (off) ...back here in the car, floatin'  in the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) (over telephone) ...Mason.  I can  barely hear you.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (over telephone) ...on ice!  We've got  Elvis on ice!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (pants - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (overlapping) (pants - continues  under following scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (chuckles - continues under following  scene and dialogue)

dialogues.text: (into telephone) Can we get out on your  end of the tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) (into telephone) There's ammo fire  from Brynner's vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into telephone) He must've had a damn  arsenal in there.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Well, hell, the smoke's  gonna kill us anyway!

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hold this. (pants - continues under  following dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (grunts and pants - continues under  following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (into telephone) I think I found a way  out.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (over telephone) There's a vent shaft  leading straight up.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Okay, I'll have a  chopper meet you at the top.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: (face off) ...-low me.  Come on, let's  go!

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN TUNNEL
dialogues.text: (pant - continues under following scenes  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Got it? (grunts) (to woman in tunnel)  Come on, darlin'. (grunting) I gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (panting) Arlo, I'm gonna get Elvis.  You  go.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) They'll meet you at the top.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Fat Man in Tunnel) Come on, big  guy!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (grunts and coughs - continues under  following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (grunts and pants - continues under  following scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (off) (panting) ...checked. (grunts and  pants - continues under following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHN
dialogues.text: I'm a professional.  This won't hurt...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (pants) Well, I'm an  amateur. (grunts - continues under  following scene)

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (off) (groans - continues under following  scene and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Come on out, son.  All right.  There ya  go.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Come on, son. (continues indistinct to)  there ya go.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: Why?  You're a nothing, nobody!  Why?

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: They took that life away and left me with  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: But now I have it all.

dialogues.speaker: BRYNNER
dialogues.text: (grunts and pants - continues under  following scenes)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Elvis is still in there!  It's gonna go  off!

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (into radio) Now!  Seal that tunnel now!

dialogues.speaker: MALE MEDIC
dialogues.text: Do you need some help gettin' in the  ambulance?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You know, we saved half a million people  from a full-body peel.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: They aren't exactly gonna publicize this,  (chuckling) Arlo. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey-Hey.  We are heroes, my  man.  It's time to start actin' like it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  I got a bullet in my leg.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (overlapping) All right, gentlemen.   We're about done here.  Fine job.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: Your country and a lot of innocent people  in it...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Who had to put a gun to your head?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Who put the big hurt on...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...that Army nut job to save your  narrow butt?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Right.  You damn skippy.  And now that I  am both jobless...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (off) ...and-and-and truckless in the  service of my country...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: ...I feel that my government owes me a  little restitution.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I'll handle this from here, sweet  (continues indistinct to) (to Vitelli)  Owes us a little restitution.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: We do have to take into consideration  that, through your courage...

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) ...and selfless actions, you did  save millions of lives.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) ...-listed personnel with detailed  knowledge of classified secrets falling  under the National Security Act.

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: In order to protect those secrets, I am  authorized to fine you, imprison you...

dialogues.speaker: VITELLI
dialogues.text: (off) ...to take any extreme measures I  deem necessary...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What about all that "no need to get in  the man's...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I was not in the man's  face.  I was nego-...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Look.  That's negotiating?   He threatened to kill...

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: But he didn't.  See, that's negotiation.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Bullshit, yeah.  Well...if we're not  gonna be famous, at least this'll be a  great story to tell some ladies in a bar  or somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Nobody-Nobody's even gonna know this  happened, except for the people that were  here, the Army, you and me...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE MEDIC
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You shouldn't be walking  on that.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE MEDIC
dialogues.text: Heard you saved a lot of lives.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE MEDIC
dialogues.text: The Army said it was a terrorist bomb.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: (overlapping, indistinct chatter and  exclamations of "Oh!" and "Ooh!" -  continues under following scene and  dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Oh.  Oh, you got me?  You got me?

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: You know, it's, uh-it's very hush-hush,  as we say in the spy game.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAINTOP
dialogues.text: (low and indistinct chatter - continues  under following scenes and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: It all started with our mission in  Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: I was undercover as a tennis player.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: My code name was Blackjack.  Night Shift  was my coach.  Uh-Uh-Uh, I'm sorry.   Mason was my coach.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Uh, he handled rackets, and I carried the  balls.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (low and indistinct to) you  see, that was a-that was my mission.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: (overlapping, indistinct chatter and  grunts - continues under following scene  and dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: Ooh, that's it.  Just grab-Just put your  arm--  Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (voice over) You got a nice strong grip  for a woman.

dialogues.speaker: ARLO
dialogues.text: (voice over) Yeah, and, uh...that's a  wonderful, wonderful walkie-talkie you  got there.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (voice over) (overlapping) Do I have to  get naked?
